Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: mandabrizown
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at Casa de'Fiori. The staff were very helpful, sweet, and great. The hotel is in a great location. The Campo de'Fiori is right outside your doorstep. In the morning you can watch the market vendors set up and then go down and pick up some fresh fruit, cheeses or spices. Then it transforms at night into a local Rome hotspot. It is also a few blocks from Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. Its centrally located inbetween Vatican city and Ancient Rome. There are restaurants galore and shopping nearby. It has its quirks like the bed is very firm but apparently after talking to other tourists that's the norm. At night, the locals hang out nearby and some people complain but I didn't hear much. Other than that I loved it! When every we return I will definatley be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: carlos b Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat if you like being in the middle of the action (and willing to accept some street noise). Our biggest issue was the strong unpleasant smell coming from the shower drain, which was mentioned to the staff but they couldn't do much about it besides letting the water run for a while for temporary relief. According to the staff this was not the only room affected. A real shame since cleanliness was otherwise not a problem at all. Another minus were the very hard beds. For the price, we would have expected more attention to such details.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Dei Fiori”
Reviews.Author: Alison S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an excellent position for all the sights which are very easy to walk to. The rooms are clean and the service excellent. The only downside is the noise from the bar under the hotel at night which is quite loud. The location however does make up for this if you go expecting this noise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CSM1234
Reviews.Content: Lovely B&B in an excellent location. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: wendy j
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from five nights in one of the apartments at Via Del Banco S Spirito. We were really impressed. It was roomy, clean and simply but elegantly decorated. We had basic provisions in the room - tea, coffee, jam, crackers - and all the kit and equipment to do a little cooking instead of eating out. The bed was large and very comfortable, there was no rowdiness outside to disturb us and breakfast lasted until ten so we didn't have to get up early at all if we didn't want to. The welcome was friendly and we were very well-treated at breakfast each morning. We were just by the river and within a minute's walk from the apartment was a beautiful view of St Peter's Basilica and in just ten minutes we could reach Vatican City. Around ten minutes walk away were lovely restaurants - especially the Cantina Lucifero in Campo De Fiori, which was sublime and Il Corallo near Piazza Navona, where the pizza was the best we've ever eaten. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Never again ! A complete rip-off”
Reviews.Author: drtrash
Reviews.Content: Here is a summary of what we experienced in this self-acclaimed “4-stars hotel”, at a double-bedroom rate of EUR 250,- per night: . We arrived last Friday, at around 6pm. No one around to open the front door. After some 5 minutes of bell-ringing, and door-banging, a young man squirreled around the corner, to open the street door, and to let us in. No welcome, no help with the luggage, which we dragged to the first floor (as there is no elevator). . The next 10 minutes are spent in a lengthy discussion about which room should be available for us. We were expected to relocate to a “second “place, Via Banco S. Spirito, of which we knew nothing. We declined, and insisted to stay at the place we booked for. . We are then given Room #102, which is far below everything we had expected from a “4-star hotel”: smallish, modestly furnished, with 1 chair only (for a couple !), the bathroom is 1.5x 1.5m-sized, and maybe OK for 1 person, impossible for 2 (you have to open the sliding door of your shower to be able to use the toilet). . No-one around all day, only a few booklets and leaflets are spread out for information. . The hotel sits on top of a bar below, with nightly “music sessions”, right until 2am, making sure you are kept awake for your “entertainment”.

Reviews.Title: “The location does it”
Reviews.Author: ppiieeff
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an old building and there is only so much you can do with that, it was very clean, the staff were extremely helpful, internet was free, you could use a lounge room to use their computer and printer, and also a nice area to chill out and read a book, although the hotel is more a place to sleep. The bathroom was cramped, but modern and everything worked. The breakfast was plentyfull, the lady working there efficient, but a slight lack of tables at 9.00 a.m. when everyone decided to be there at the same time during the period we were there. No outside noises, which is amazing for the amount of activity outside on the main square. Would definetely recommend this hotel because of it's ideal location and ample facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not the one we expected”
Reviews.Author: wernerkn
Reviews.Content: As shown by the rating we were very pleased with our stay at Casa de' Fiori. Except that in spite of its name it was not the hotel we had expected. From the hotel's name, address and description it appears as a hotel located at the corner of Campo de' Fiori. The "mother-hotel" is, but Casa de' Fiori are two physically separate hotels. The second (where we stayed) is fantastically located on Via Banco di Santo Spirito, a few meters from the Ponte Sant'Angelo - but this "detail" of approx. one kilometer can be deduced only from the name of the room type - nowhere it is told that there are two different hotels with the same owner and same name. This problem was common to most of the guests we met at Via Banco di Santo Spirito location of the hotel. Both hotels have the same standard, but you must be aware of this problem if it matters to you whether you will be staying at Campo de' Fiori or at Castel Sant'Angelo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice B & B in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie C
Reviews.Content: After some initial confusion.....we were actually booked into a location a short distance away from the site on the piazza....we were taken by cab to a lovely building a short walk from Castel Sant Angelo. Huge and well appointed room including a kitchen area, Paulina, the location manager, looking after us in every way, and a nice breakfast in a common area every morning. Recommending this place, and would happily stay there again. Great value as well.,

Reviews.Title: “We will always stay here in Rome”
Reviews.Author: riskman4
Reviews.Content: Our plane arrived 5 hours before check-in. The hotel had a place for our luggage, and they asked us to join them for breakfast free. The location by the Campo di Fiori was great. Busy Campo, lots of tourists, but not as bad as Piazza Navonna or near the Spanish steps or Trevi, and lots of the bustle was Italians and not tourists. Breakfast was good, ask for cappucino, room was clean and airy although there was a/c if we needed it. Computer with internet for our use. Friendly staff. I did not give 5 stars because an elevator would be nice after hiking all over Rome, but it did not diminish the fun of the trip. Speaking of walking, you could walk to most historic spots in Rome, and being just 2 minute walk from a main street (Vittorio Emmanuelle) made it easy to find your way back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Pea18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was right in the heart of Campo De Fiori. The prices were reasonable and the reviews were really positive. We couldn't have been happier with our choice. The Campo was a great way to enjoy the Roman lifestyle (keeping in mind that they are catering to the tourists!). The breakfast was ok; but there wasn't a huge selection (many of the pastries were in convenience packs). The people that ran the hotel were friendly and very helpful. Our room was really nice and had a wonderful newly renovated bathroom. You do need to catch a bus or taxi from the train station because it is about a 45-60 minute walk. The location of this hotel is also good for seeing some of the best 'sites', close at hand. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED Casa de'Fiori!!!!”
Reviews.Author: clonella
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not have been more perfect for our family adventure to Rome. The location is UNBEATABLE - literally steps from Campo de Fiori with it's many restaurants and amazing morning market. And then only a few steps beyond that to the beautiful Piazza Navonna and the Pantheon. PERFECT location. And the hotel is so charming!!! Very few rooms, so wonderfully quiet. We had a terrific family room, and a kitchen and living room right outside our door - and being so small, we rarely saw any other guests using these facilities - it felt like our own apartment! Even though the hotel is so close to the busy Campo de Fiori, we never heard any noise at night - the windows kept it all out!! And the owners were so kind and helpful. We feel really really lucky to have found Casa de"Fiori. A wonderful family stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Appartments 52 Via del Banco di Santo Spirito”
Reviews.Author: Mahonia
Reviews.Content: There should really be two sites for Casa de' Fiori as judging by the other reviews it is a very different experience in each of the two locations. Our self catering studio apartment for 2 adults 2 children was ideal. Cool, clean, peaceful - no road noise at all. Aircon and wifi worked perfectly. Clean bathroom and although it was self catering, the beds were made every day. Very convenient for the old part of Rome. 10 mins walk to the Vatican. We loved Castel d'Angelo and all the nightlife by the bridge/river. Francesca (from the hotel) was very helpful but we didn't realise how easy it was to use the free phone in the hall to contact reception at the main hotel site to get more information and wished we had asked more. There is no infomation provided in the apartment and we didn't find the supermarket until the last day. Having said that we didn't starve as there is a super bakery/deli a few doors down the street. Avoid eating around the Piazza Navona as it is a tourist nightmare - the worst "italian" food that I have ever been served. Francesca told me afterwards that everybody who knows avoids it.

Reviews.Title: “All the necessities in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: GoGauchos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for part of our honeymoon and absolutely loved it! We walked EVERYWHERE! It's also right in the area with all the restaurants and bars so we felt like we were always right in the action! The service was wonderful and they have free internet. I definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “You'll get your money's worth”
Reviews.Author: Angie1987
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 3 days and 2 nights at Casa de'Fiori. We took a taxi from the airport and when we arrived they told us we were not booked for that location. Apparently they have several of them. They covered the cost of the roughly ten minute taxi ride and explained that when we make reservations online, those companies do not give them contact information so they are unable to advise travelers which location they are booked at. The location we stayed at is convenient. It is across from Castel Sant'Angelo and close to other touristic attractions like the Colosseo and Vatican. Our room consisted of a double bed, which was not two twin beds put together, had a safe, a nice restroom but the room was a bit small. It was clean, no complaints about that. Paula, the girl who works at this location was helpful when she was there. She is there until about 3pm and after that there is no one from the hotel to assist you. At least in that location. This location does have an elevator. The main location does not. The last night we were unable to get the AC going in our room and had to sleep with the windows open but it was not hot. The next morning they explained that the AC will not work if you do not shut the windows all the way. Which I'm guessing that's what happened. We checked out on Sunday morning but had a few more hours until our train left for Venice so we thought we could leave our luggage with the hotel while we roamed the city. We were unable to leave it at the location we stayed at because Paula would be gone by the time we returned. We asked her if they would cover our taxi to the main location and she said no. When we finally got to the main location there was no one there. We buzzed almost ten minutes until another traveler let us in. We then waited at the main reception almost 20 minutes. No one ever came. We took the risk and left our luggage there and left. Overall I would stay at this hotel again but we did not like the fact that we have to move to other locations only because they cannot inform us of which location our room is at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families and Groups”
Reviews.Author: islandermama
Reviews.Content: We met our group at this hotel and half of our group was assigned to a different location. They have more than one location for the hotel buildings. At first it seemed like a pain because we had our luggage and toddler to repack into a cab but the staff accompanied us in the cab and paid the tab. She showed us to our new building (on Ponte Sant Angelo?) which did have an elevator, which was great since we had the stroller (there were still one or two steps to go up). Our group had several rooms that were larger and down the same hallway. The room was wonderful. It was small but had a couch and it was very clean. They had a large family come in the next night so they ask us to move to the very next room which wasn't a big deal. The breakfast in the common area was great. The staff was very pleasant. I thought the location was excellent. We walked from there to the Pantheon and all the way to the Colloseum and the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little B and B type hotel”
Reviews.Author: MotherMariettaGA
Reviews.Content: Loved this little hotel. Only 9 rooms. Great location just off the square with shops and restaurants. No elevator so, if you can't do steps, book somewhere else. If you can do steps, the rooms are worth the climb. Cute little marble winding staircase. 9 rooms on 3 different floors. Small rooms but clean and cute. Francesca greeted us and let us keep our bags there until check in. Serviceman and breakfast monitor were very pleasant and very helpful. This is like a small, quaint B&B. They made all of the breakfast items and the wonderful smells filled the halls the night before. Continental breakfast was yummy with breads, pastries, fruit, juice and coffee. There was a street party in the streets below our window until 3 a.m. or so, but it didn't keep us up. It was just part of the area culture. If you like small and quaint in a good location, Casa De'Fiori is a nice choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and overall stay”
Reviews.Author: globo8
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Casa de Fiori! We took the 45 euro car service from the airport, which was worth it for us. Location was well within walking distance (15-20 minutes) from the Vatican, Piazza Navona, the Pantheon. Our room was huge (the one on the main street- which was noisy at night, but we were ok with that), which I'm sure is unusual for Rome: high ceilings, big bed, fold out couch, small kitchen, and bathroom. About the only negative would be if you have a lot of luggage the elevator is tiny and so I ended up carrying our stuff up the stairs, but that's to be expected in a good location in any big city. Rooms were set up as apartments with a common area. Breakfast was really good (by far the best out of two other hotels we stayed at in Italy) with prosciutto, cheese, bread, yogurt, fresh fruit, juice, milk, cereal. When I asked about more strawberries for our small child Paola even went out of her way and walked to a nearby store to get more! Casa de Fiori is definitely a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Apartment option great! Take the private limo service they offer for 45 euros”
Reviews.Author: virtuaplyr
Reviews.Content: Since there were 3 of us on a busy June 11 weekend in Rome, we got assigned to the apartment section of Casa de Fiori and not the hotel. We were pleasantly surpised with the room. High ceiling, Kitchenette, King size bed with pull out sofa. Spacious and working shower. Very clean room. Paula was awesome, she takes care of the rooms and fixes the free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jannycamUtah
Reviews.Content: We love the location of this hotel. It is just around the corner from Campo de Fiori, a lively, colorful piazza in what we consider to be the most charming part of Rome (near the Pantheon and Piazza Navona.) Well insulated windows keep out the noise of what seems to be all night partying in the Piazza. Our room had a small sitting area as well as a lovely common sitting area shared by 3 other rooms. The beds are hard, but that was usually the case with our beds throughout Italy. We had previously stayed at the charming Hotel Campo de Fiori, but their prices had gone up so high that we found this to be a good alternative since it is practically next door. If you don't mind walking, this is a great center point. We walked everywhere from the Vatican to the Spanish Steps, even though some of these walks are quite long. Also, you will be walking up stairs since the hotel has no lift. But we prefer the ambiance of this part of town as opposed to the big, "downtown" feel of the Spanish steps area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Very Very noisy!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yowman1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a fantastic location, with all major attractions no further than 30 minuets steady walk away. Staff were helpfull and room was clean and more than adequate, although the bed was very very hard. Unfortunately students from a nearby university congregate outside the hotel every weekend (we had it Friday, Saturday & Sunday) and make an horrendous noise chanting football songs, smashing bottles etc. this went on until 3.30am Fri/Sat and around 1.00am Sunday. When I asked if this was a regular occurence I was told it was and that the council new it was an issue?? Not a Hotel I would ever stay at again, but purely for the noise which is obviously out of their control, which unfortunately makes a hotel which should be rated as Very Good rated Poor

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: briskyfingers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 5 friends for my 40th Birthday. The location is brilliant, easy to walk to most of the tourist sites. There's a lovely market square across from the hotel surrounded by cafes which are more reasonably priced than those in the tourist traps. The market is great and I was amazed how well the square was cleaned up each night. The hotel has character, I was so pleased we didn't stay in one of the 'chain' hotels. The breakfast was plentiful and varied, we were offered cappuccino or espresso each morning. The bed was comfy and the room just what you needed for a city break. It can be a little noisy outside at night due to the local cafes and bars - but I can't say that it bothered me. I would certainly recommend the hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent B&B - very friendly staff, clean rooms, surprisingly quiet and excellent location for exploring Rome from.”
Reviews.Author: CJCOH
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because of its location primarily - near some friends of ours who lived close by but whose 'inn was full.' I've visited Rome 5 times now and have never had a bad hotel experience. We whittled the choice down to this one and the more expensive hotel just across the street with a similar name. To save a few pennies for icecream etc we decided on this one but it certainly didn't feel like the 'economy' option once we were there. It is centrally located and even with a 16m old, walking to Piazza Navonna, The Pantheon, The Vatican and The Colosseum (in distance order) was pleasant and no problem. To be able to visit the Campo de'Fiori and Piazza Navonna at the drop of a hat was a real treat. I am actually a fan of the Metro as it always seems so much simpler than the Roman bus system but this area is about as far away from the nearest Metro as you can be in central Rome - so you might need to brave the buses if you're not walkers! The hotel from the outside is understated and there is no sign so make a note of the address before leaving. The spiral staircase (no lift - you can see why) was a challenge at first but the extremely friendly and helpful staff helped us with the luggage etc. The rooms, reception and breakfast area are over 3 floors. We were on the top floor. I was concerned after reading other reports that as we were overlooking the streets we were in for a distrubed night but once I had worked out how to seal the window properly the loud conversations and motorbike passing by were faint murmurs. The room was very clean and perfectly adequate for us all. The decor was traditional and pleasant and we were provided with a cot and bedding for out daughter. There was ample room for her to run around and leave her toys everywhere! The rooms were immaculately cleaned and tidied every day. The bathroom was again very clean with a toilet, sink, walk in shower and beday. Breakfast (served literally just ouside our room - but again good soundproofing) was as you would expect - cereal, fruit, juices, teas and coffees, pastries, cakes, cheese, hams, yoghurts etc. Any questions were readily answered by the staff who made us feel more than welcome with our toddler who loved all the wawas (flowers). Highly recommended and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,clean,Spacious,functional,friendly,hard bed and noisy.”
Reviews.Author: stevenashton123
Reviews.Content: "This must be it" my wife said as we presented our documents to the girl behind the counter. With a knowing smile she pointed to the green door on the oposite side of the street. An unassuming green door presented it self, i pushed the buzzer and up we went along the narrow steep staircase.You are presented with a functional clean enviroment met by friendly and helpfull staff.Our room was on the first floor on the right,our imeadiate reaction was OH! ok Its clean and its a good size if a little sparse. The TV took some working out and like me little slow to react but i got the hang of it.The bed was simmilar to sleeping on a slab of roman marble but i didnt mind that but you may. After filling ourselves with wine and pasta on sat night we walked back to our hotel and were presented with 50/60 young italians outside the bar below our room making an incredible noise,this went on till 12-1 in the morning although anoying it was all part of the rome experiance(the wine helped).The location is fantastic and easy to reach most of the main sights. The breakfast was very basic bread,cerial from a dispencer that was very unwilling to dispense in the end i gave up.Good coffee and juice but not a sausage or egg in sight. It was difficult to make my secret sandwich for my elevenses with such offerings. stay here and you wont be dissapointed like a ford boring but reliable.The staff were great!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in fantastic location with helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RandJS-Richmond
Reviews.Content: This is the most charming small, local hotel. With the windows and shutters open, you can hear the fun sounds (chatter, laughter, singing etc.) from the Campo di Fiori. This area is full of restaurants, bars and street players and buskers; it is a lively, fun and (relatively) young area of the city. It is within walking distance of pretty much anywhere in the centre of Rome ... Piazza Navona 5 mins, Pantheon 7 mins, Collisseum 15 mins, Vatican 25-30 mins, Via Corsa (main shopping street) 10 mins. That said, if you like really quiet locations this hotel is probably not for you, nor if you have a disability or problems with stairs! But the staff are helpful, friendly and speak marvellous English. We circumvented a 2-2.5 hour queue at the Vatican museum with the aid of the concierge and she couldn't have been more charming!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL B&B GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: rosevas
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 8 so we had 4 private rooms with private baths. They were all clean an spacious, comfortable. The staff were wonderful and helpful and the breakfast was great and yummy. Would for sure go back and stay again... close to everything! My husband and I were totally impressed and happy for casadefiori.com

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay in city centre Rome”
Reviews.Author: MortenHorten
Reviews.Content: After looking for a hotel on the net for so long, we decided to chance it on this one. We were so happy we did. The central location made everything within walking distance. Coloseum about 15 mins, Piazza Navona about 5, Pantheon 5. The farthest we walked was to the Vatican, which is probably about 20-25 mins. I think there is only about 8 rooms to this place, but the room we had was a great size and overlooked the dead end of an alley leading in from the Campo di fiori. So it was quiet in an otherwise noisy city Simple, but sufficient breakfast. Very pleasent service-minded staff. No Wi-Fi, but you can lend a PC. All in all, the location is unbeatable and the staff friendly, so we felt very pleased with our stay !

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value, nice people”
Reviews.Author: jlb1717
Reviews.Content: We had such a great stay here. My wife, Mum & 3 yr old son stayed in one of the air-conditioned rooms with a queen size bed and large (surprisingly comfortable) sofa bed. There was plenty of room for the four of us, the air-con was effective, good sized bathroom. The provided breakfast was nice if not spectacular. The staff were the shining jewel of the place. All were so very friendly and helpful. The location is superb with the Campo de Fiori right out the door, and many of the major sights of Rome within short walking distance. One small disappointment was the lack of wireless internet access. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and value in Roma”
Reviews.Author: baronejenn
Reviews.Content: I usually stay around the Campo de Fiori, walking distance to the sights, the fountains and the area of Trastevere, one of my favorites. This time I stayed at Casa de'Fiori, so far it has been the best hotel I've stayed at in Rome. Huge room for the rate, which was one of the lowest I had seen for the high season. Super high ceilings, lots of windows and super modern bathroom, looked brand new, very clean but still had style. Great breakfast and helpful energetic staff. They even arranged a ride for us to the airport, it turned out to be in a plush new Mercedes Benz. Not bad for the end of a great honeymoon! The only warning is that Campo de Fiori can be quite loud at night, but as long as the windows are shut, we had a sound and comfortable sleep. They also had air conditioning so you didn't need to keep them open. Highly Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “great being near the market”
Reviews.Author: eandpfamily
Reviews.Content: this was a very nice hotel, we had difficulty finding it, we didn't find the directions as easy to understand regarding the bus and therefore tried to walk there from the coliseum, which proved harder than we planned. once in the right place we were directed to the green door with a small sign that said the hotel name. we felt unsure walking up the stairs but once into our room it was very nice. good size room with one large bed and one pull out bed. bathroom was quite nice as well. beautiful window that opened up and had a view of the market. it was in a great location regarding the market and little food places along the street, even late at night. really nice atmosphere. bus stop not too far away and although somewhat tricky to understand, particularly the payment, we never paid for a bus and no one seemed to care about that, it was convenient to get places. would consider staying here again for a return trip to rome although not near some of the big sites.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: mr_chu
Reviews.Content: I would like to start with saying there is no elevator in this hotel and the entrance is deceiving. Once you get past that the place is great. Rooms are a bit small but so are most rooms in Europe. The location is great in my opinion as there are many different places to eat and drink once you exit the hotel. It can get loud at night so if you have to get up early for tours it may be a draw back to some. It was not for me but I was also looking for a great location to drink and people watch so this was more of a plus in my opinion. Great stay and regardless of what might be said Campo de Fiori is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: rogergiles
Reviews.Content: Casa de'Fiori is a good value, small hotel in a perfect location. Staff excellent and provided you arrive in office hours all is well, complicated re keys etc if you don't., Downsides. Rooms very small, steep stairs with no lift, breakfasts repetitive in content, and rather noisy outside on Saturday night. (Windows shut out most noise) . Still, good value for money and location just about makes up for eveything else.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and cosy in a lovely location.”
Reviews.Author: SwedeLisa
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel. Before we arrived, I was a bit concerned that reception wasn't open at night, but it wasn't a problem. The rooms are rustic style, but comfortable, large and clean. Modern ensuite bathroom. There is free internet in the rooms. The staff was friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was simple, but tasty. There were always fresh pastries and some sort of cake/pie. There are windy stairs both to the rooms and the breakfast, so this is not the place for those with reduced mobility. The best thing is the location. It can be a little tricky to find, because it's a little hidden away in a small square, in the corner of a lovely bigger square. In the morning there is a fresh food market there. This area isn't just for tourists, except for the restaurants in the bigger square- pricey and mainstream. It's very central, we walked everywhere from here. The Vatican, Colosseum, the Spanish steps and so on. There are bus stops and taxi stands about 200 m from the hotel as well though. There is a supermarket quite close by- ask the hotel staff to mark it on the free map you get in the hotel. There is a nice pizzeria just by the door to the hotel, and it is worth looking around to find the reasonably priced restaurants that the locals go to. We ate in the Jewish quarters a few times, and also in a great place around the corner from the hotel. Tables outside, lots of locals, tasty food, friendly staff and good value wine. It's really worth it exploring Rome by foot- go down the smaller streets, they are very quiet even at the height of summer. A lot of tourists just go the quickest route from sight to sight, so those streets can be crammed, but one street over virtually empty. I would love to go back to Rome, and I when I do, I'll probably stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply dreadful”
Reviews.Author: FastCarFerrari
Reviews.Content: The pre-arrival communication with Dario at the hotel was perfectly good, leading me to believe that we would have a good personalised service during our stay. We were collected from the airport, but by the time we got to the hotel all the staff had gone home and we were expected to phone a number left pinned to the front door - not a good security measure! A very unwelcoming man arrived and let us in without much communication. After a lengthy wait, he showed us to our room. Much more basic than I had been expecting, but clean enough. We had a lovely walk followed by dinner near the Piazza Navonna and themn returned back to the hotel, exhausted from travelling and ready to have a good night's sleep. Well if only we were allowed! Our room was directly about the Bar/Club below and the thumping music played until the early hours. Once that stopped, we discovererd that there was the constant sound of running water from the bathroom - it was like the toilet cistern would never come to a stop. We did not sleep at all. In the morning, we spoke to a lady at reception. She was in total denial of any of our issues - the bar and the running water. She was so rude and obnoxious to us. She refused to listen to the water problem (it was still running in the morning!). She also said that she would not be able to move us to another room. When I said that we would be checking out immediately, she tried to charge us for a full 3 nights. There was no chance of her getting any more than one dreadful night's worth (EUR 135!). We walked acorss the square and booked into the Hotel Campo De Fiori for a quite wonderful stay. I never heard a single word of apology from the Campo de Fiori afterwards. They have my email address as they were more than communicative in advance of my stay. I would strongly advise caution when booking this hotel - if its the only place available then book it for its location, but take ear plugs and make sure you get a top floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerIL
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, only 9 rooms, which was recently renovated. The rooms are beautiful and clean. The bed is comfortable, the overall feeling is very cozy with beautiful marble floor and wooden beam ceiling. The managers are very friendly, always willing to help. Breakfast is rich, with wide selection of food and drinks. The location is absolutely perfect! right in the heart of Rome and within walking distance from everywhere. We enjoyed staying in this hotel and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “very basic hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: punjabi_angel
Reviews.Content: Hotel as said is in a very good central location. It is outside camp di fiori and minutes from piazza navona and pantheon. Remaining sites are within easy reach on foot or by bus. The hotel itself is basic. The exterior leaves a lot to desire especially in comparison to the hotel opposite, which is more grand. Inside, once you have climbed the stairs, which makes this hotel a definite no to the elderly or those with disabilites, you reach the rooms themselves. The room and bathroom (shower only-but nice and hot!) are clean and adequate for those needing a base to explore the sites of Rome. Breakfast is very simple. Don't expect a fry up! Staff were friendly and pleasant. Worth staying here if you could get a good price, mainly for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: L0veT0TravelAr0und
Reviews.Content: Casa de Fiori provided a most perfect stay. The staff was extremely helpful and understanding, the rooms seemed brand new and were very clean. It is in a great central location, which made it very easy to get to all of the sights in the city. There is also an outdoor market around the corner during the day and at night the area is full of life; great restaurants/bars/shops. Would recommend this place to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ValentinoRossi46
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in November 2008. I have been to Rome before but this was by far the best location I have stayed in. It cost us 25 euros in a taxi from the termini but that was during rush hour so was to be expected. The hotel is within walking distance of everything you want to see. It is right in the middle of Rome. We even walked to Colosseum which is the other end of town and that only took us 25 mins. The hotel is right on the campo di fiori which is a lovely square which has a market and comes alive at night with bars a resturants. Friday and Saturday nights are really busy. The campo is nosy (people not traffic) but we didn't find the hotel nosy at all and we were on the front. Its great to watch all the actvity from the window. The hotel is typically Italian. There is no lift but the spiral staircase is lovely and you feel more like you are staying in an apartment than a hotel. The rooms are lovely - flat screen TV, gorgeous shower, mini bar. The rooms are cleaned daily and are immaculate. The only complant was that the bed was very hard, however we still slept well. The breakfast is continental and was perfectly adequate except that there wasn't enough decent bread. It was nothing to get excited about and was the kind of food you get at a pensione rather than a hotel. The reception speak English if you need that. We only saw them once. Thankfully we didn't need them until the last night when we wanted them to order us a taxi but we couldn't find anyone. In the end we went over to the Hotel Campo de Fiori and they ordered one for us. There is however a taxi rank about a 5 minute walk away - go to the main road and turn right and keep walking to find it. All in all we had a great time and couldn't really fault the hotel for the money. If you want a fantastic location and to feel really part of Roman life then I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “What you need, where you need it”
Reviews.Author: jorrep
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with the other reviewers here. This is a small, new, relatively cheap hotel run by young and enthusiastic staff, in the best of locations - on a small piazza connected to the lively Campo de Fiori. Rooms with all modern amenities. Excellent bars and restaurants everywhere (not least in the same building). On the downside there is the smell from the basement (only noticeable in the hallway, though) and the windling staircase making it quite hard even for well-trained guests to carry heavy luggage to their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: hempest
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Casa de'fiori through a word of mouth referal from a traveler we met in Florence. The hotel was a perfect compliment to our style of travel. I like to visit places with a more local flavor rather than the same old corporate hotel. Casa de'Fiori was extremely clean and comfortable and right in the heart of all the action in Rome. I read the previous review regarding the noise, but to me, the noise felt more like Rome and less like noise. Dario, the manager was extremely friendly and helpful and made a few fantastic recommendations for good food and some local nightspots. It really helped make our vacation. Rooms had private baths and are extremely clean and well tended to. Our bed was very comfy as well. There is no elevator, which may be a problem for some, but if you want a clean, comfortable home away from home, and do as the Romans do, this the place for you.

HotelInfo.Name: Casa de'Fiori
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza del Biscione, 83, 00186 Rome, Italy
